data.title: John In Arizona Radio and TV Stations
meta_keywords: photos radio television tv qsl verifications johninarizona
data.text:
Michigan Radio Station Photos from the John in Arizona Collection

The photos in the Michigan section are listed in alphabetical order by call letters. All photos are the property of John C Johnson / John In Arizona / johninarizona.com and may not be used in any form elsewhere. All rights reserved.

Michigan Welcome Sign - 2021.

WAGN: WAGN Radio 1340 Menominee studios are located in Marinette, Wisconsin. More photos of the station are found on the Wisconsin page of this website. Their transmitter and tower are located in Menominee on 10th Avenue near 2nd Street as seen in the photos from 2021. This tower also holds their FM translator W261DM 100.1.

WAGN Radio 1340 Menominee studios in Marinette, Wisconsin - 2021.

WAGN Radio 1340 Menominee tower on 10th Avenue - 2021.

WAGN Radio 1340 Menominee tower on 10th Avenue - 2021.

WLCJ-LP: WLCJ LP FM 92.5 airs Relevant Radio Catholic programming from the Holy Spirit Catholic Church located at the corner of 10th Avenue and 10th Street in Menominee. The photo is of the sign on the side of the church.

WLCJ-LP FM 92.5 Menominee Relevant Radio sign - 2021.

WWJ TV: Channel 4 Detroit started out in 1946 as WWDT. In 1947 the call letters were changed to WWJ TV to match their WWJ radio station. In 1978 the calls were changed to WDIV TV. The WWJ TV call letters are now located on Detroit's Channel 62. The late 1950's print ad features Ron Gamble.

WWJ TV Channel 4 Detroit Ron Gamble print ad - 1957.

WXYZ TV: WXYZ TV Channel 7 Detroit started out in 1948. The late 1950's print ad features the program lineup for Johnny Ginger, Sagebrush Shorty, Rita Bell, and Pat Morris.

WXYZ TV Channel 7 Detroit print ad - 1957.

All photos are the property of John C Johnson / John In Arizona / johninarizona.com and may not be used in any form elsewhere including social media sites. All rights reserved.
